title: 'Have enough of our own ... ': Putin acknowledges Trump, PM Modi’s role in Ukraine talks
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin expressed gratitude to leaders including India's PM Modi and US President Trump for their efforts to end the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Putin agreed to a ceasefire if it leads to long-term peace, appreciating international support for peaceful resolution. PM Modi emphasized India's active role and reiterated the importance of negotiation over warfare.

title: 'Whole world knows where ... ': India slams Pak’s allegation on train hijacking
content: India has strongly rejected Pakistan's allegations of involvement in the Balochistan train hijacking, pointing out Pakistan's issues with internal terrorism. Accusations emerged after the Balochistan Liberation Army seized the Jaffar Express, resulting in 58 deaths. Afghanistan also denied Pakistan's claims, urging Islamabad to address its own security challenges.

title: 'Lured to Punjab': GRP takes 18 off train to stop their ‘conversion’
content: Madhya Pradesh government railway police detained 18 passengers from the Patalkot Express for allegedly being lured into converting to Christianity with promises of financial rewards and opportunities abroad. The detentions followed a tip-off from Bajrang Dal officials and a subsequent coordinated operation.

title: Watch: A look inside ex-Andhra CM Jagan Reddy’s lavish sea-facing mansion
content: A mansion built for former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy in Visakhapatnam is facing scrutiny for its opulent design and high costs. Once intended as a camp office, the project has evolved through various stages, now sparking a debate on its usage and the ethics of public spending. The extravagance compares to Arvind Kejriwal's controversial residence renovation.

title: Axar Patel named Delhi Capitals captain for IPL 2025
content: Axar Patel has been named the new captain of Delhi Capitals for the upcoming IPL season. The experienced all-rounder, who has played 150 IPL matches, replaces Rishabh Pant. Delhi Capitals are the last team to announce their captain, with KL Rahul among the key players expected to support Axar’s leadership going into the 2025 season.

title: Musk claims Soros, Reid Hoffman behind Tesla protests; Fortnite CEO replies angrily
content: Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney supports Elon Musk's claims that protests against Tesla are funded by billionaire donors, connecting it to Epic's battle with Big Tech. Sweeney criticizes deceptive funding of anti-Tesla campaigns and their violent fringes. Protests have intensified globally, reflecting dissatisfaction with Musk's political engagements, leading to notable incidents and public displays of disapproval.

title: ‘Not among us’: Bijapur villagers protest rehab of Maoist who killed over 100 jawans
content: Locals of Gangaloor village in Chhattisgarh are protesting against the reintegration of surrendered Maoist commander Dinesh Modiyam, calling for his death sentence. Villagers demand justice as Dinesh, responsible for numerous murders and extortions, turns himself in, citing fear for his life as the reason for his surrender.

title: Rupee symbol designer reacts to Stalin govt using Tamil letter in Budget
content: IIT Guwahati Professor D Udaya Kumar, who designed the Indian rupee symbol, distanced himself from the controversy over Tamil Nadu's decision to replace the Devanagari symbol with a Tamil letter in its budget logo. The state government's move is part of a larger language policy dispute with the central government. Kumar emphasized the autonomy of state decisions.

title: Anupam Mittal on Singapore's Temasek buying 10% stake in Haldiram for $10 billion
content: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal reacted to Temasek’s acquisition of a 9-10% stake in Haldiram's, valuing it at nearly $10 billion. This deal marks significant foreign investment in India's FMCG sector, with Temasek aiming to expand its footprint in the rapidly growing market.

title: 'Don't think India had unfair advantage': McGrath on Dubai controversy
content: Glenn McGrath supports Jasprit Bumrah's recovery from a back injury and stresses the importance of smart management due to his age. Bumrah's experience makes him invaluable to India. McGrath commends India for their smart play in the Champions Trophy, rejecting claims of unfair advantage. India's strong white-ball cricket is noted with emphasis on the influence of IPL.

title: Ranya Rao case: What does blank ‘accused column’ in CBI FIR mean for netas & babus
content: CBI has filed an FIR in Delhi regarding a gold-smuggling case allegedly involving actor Ranya Rao, without naming any specific individuals but identifying "unknown public servants" and "unknown private persons" as suspects. This step has intensified the investigation, potentially uncovering deep-rooted corruption within government circles.

title: 75+ Holi messages, greetings, wishes, and quotes
content: Holi 2025, the festival of colors, marks the arrival of spring and the triumph of good over evil. People globally exchange heartfelt messages, wishes, and greetings, spreading happiness and positivity among friends, family, and loved ones. Celebrate the spirit of togetherness with joy and vibrant colors.

title: Elon Musk almost 'choking' in interview talking about Tesla struggles and…
content: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, expressed emotional strain in a Fox Business interview due to challenges with his companies and Tesla’s stock experiencing a significant decline. Increased government involvement and attacks on Tesla facilities have raised investor concerns. Musk managing multiple ventures with difficulty, as seen in the video, suggests he is under immense pressure.

title: US judge orders Trump admin to reinstate fired govt employees
content: A federal judge in San Francisco has ordered the Trump administration to reinstate numerous dismissed probationary workers, asserting that the terminations were executed without proper authority. The administration plans to appeal the ruling, while multiple lawsuits against these dismissals are ongoing.

title: 'Putin preparing refusal but afraid to tell Trump': Zelenskyy on Ukraine truce
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy has criticized Russian President Putin for his hesitancy regarding the US-proposed 30-day ceasefire. Zelenskyy accuses Putin of using manipulation and creating complications to indirectly refuse the ceasefire, while asserting that Russia prefers to prolong the conflict despite the opportunity for peace.

title: Watch: Messi's late strike sends Miami into Champions Cup quarters
content: Lionel Messi made a spectacular return for Inter Miami, scoring in a 2-0 win over Cavalier FC, securing a 4-0 aggregate victory in the CONCACAF Champions Cup. Messi's goal and Luis Suárez's penalty confirmed Miami's quarter-final spot. Coach Mascherano praised Messi's impact, while Cavalier's spirited performance was commended despite the loss.

title: Watch: American Airlines plane bursts into flames at Denver airport
content: A fire broke out on an American Airlines plane at Denver International Airport due to an engine malfunction. Passengers were forced to evacuate onto the wing of the aircraft. There were no immediate reports of injuries. This incident follows several other aviation accidents in the US this year, including collisions and crashes involving both commercial and military aircraft.

title: 13,000 more general tickets than daily average sold at NDLS on stampede day: Vaishnaw
content: On Feb 15, New Delhi railway station sold 13,000 more general tickets than average, coinciding with a tragic crowd rush resulting in 18 deaths. Despite operating five special trains, the rush exceeded expectations. An inquiry is ongoing, and officials have been transferred. Ticket procurement practices and alternatives were also highlighted by Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.

title: Centre sets tough conditions for India entry by Starlink
content: The Central Government has requested Starlink, Elon Musk's satellite venture, to establish a control centre in India. This measure will enable the suspension or shutdown of communications services in sensitive areas when needed to maintain law and order. Additionally, call interceptions by law enforcement agencies must be facilitated. Starlink is working with Reliance Jio and Airtel for network enhancements.

title: Chahal to re-join Northamptonshire for 2025 County season after IPL
content: Yuzvendra Chahal will return to Northamptonshire for the 2025 County Championship after impressive performances in 2024. The India leg-spinner, joining post-IPL 2025, will play until season-end. Chahal's 2024 stint saw him take 19 wickets in four first-class games. New head coach Darren Lehmann and CEO Ray Payne expressed enthusiasm for his return.

title: Stock market holidays: Are BSE and NSE closed for trading on Holi ?
content: Stock market holidays 2025: Indian stock exchanges BSE and NSE will close on Friday for Holi, creating an extended weekend. With 14 holidays in 2025, trading is suspended for various significant occasions, including Ramzan Id this month.

title: Only 388 Indian illegals in US verified, all back in India: Govt
content: India has identified 388 illegal Indian immigrants in the US since President Trump's deportation campaign. These individuals have been verified and returned to India, mainly through aid from the International Organisation for Migration. There's ongoing verification of more nationals. Authorities emphasize the need to crack down on the illegal migration industry and prosecute agents involved.

title: Centre asks Ahmedabad court to deliver US regulator’s summons to Adani
content: The Union law ministry has instructed a district court in Ahmedabad to deliver a summons issued by the US Securities and Exchange Commission to Gautam Adani concerning alleged securities fraud and a $265 million bribery scheme. This summons requires Adani or his legal representatives to appear in the US court.

title: 'Chhaava' box office day 28: Vicky Kaushal starrer misses Rs 550 crore mark
content: Vicky Kaushal's historical drama 'Chhaava' has grossed Rs 540.45 Cr over four weeks. The movie, directed by Laxman Utekar, earned significantly in the first two weeks but saw a dip in collections thereafter. It had a notable 90% growth boost on Women's Day.

title: 70% of Manipur weapons surrendered after guv call came from 4 valley districts
content: Nearly 70% of the weapons surrendered in Manipur came from four Valley districts — Imphal East, Imphal West, Thoubal, and Bishnupur. These surrenders followed a call given by governor Ajay Bhalla. A total of 991 weapons, along with thousands of ammunition items, grenades, bombs, and IEDs, were turned in by rebels and protesters.

title: Jeremy Stephens signs with UFC Again: Faces Mason Jones at UFC Des Moines
content: Jeremy Stephens is set to return to the UFC after over three years, with a fight in Des Moines, Iowa against Mason Jones on May 3. Now 38, Stephens seeks a resurgence after recent successes in various combat sports, including a TKO win in bare-knuckle fighting.

title: Jobs, education pledge in Chhattisgarh Maoist surrender policy
content: Chhattisgarh has introduced a new policy focused on the surrender, relief, and rehabilitation of Maoists, victims of Naxal violence, and civilians aiding the police. The policy offers financial incentives, free education, job opportunities, and enhanced compensation for surrendered weapons. This initiative aims to accelerate the reduction of Left-wing extremism ahead of the 2026 deadline set by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Puducherry to adopt 3-language policy, mantri says Cong imposed Hindi on TN
content: Puducherry will implement a three-language policy, allowing students to choose a third language, which can be a regional language instead of Hindi. Minister A Namassivayam refuted allegations of Hindi imposition. Opposing parties condemned the decision. Schools in Puducherry recently switched to CBSE, while those in Mahe and Yanam follow Kerala and Andhra boards respectively.

title: Pakistan hints at India role in deadly train hijacking
content: Pakistan hints at India’s involvement in the Balochistan train hijacking, linking attackers to handlers in Afghanistan allegedly sponsored by India. The incident, implicating the Balochistan Liberation Army, left 58 dead and highlights ongoing regional tensions and security issues. Afghanistan rejects Pakistan’s claims, and India is yet to respond to the allegations.

title: Only 1,525 DLs cancelled in 5 years despite digital efforts to curb violations
content: In the past five years, only 1,525 driving licenses were cancelled for traffic violations nationwide, with Tamil Nadu accounting for half of these. This low number contrasts sharply with a mere handful of cancellations in states like Delhi, Bengal, Haryana, and Maharashtra. Road transport minister Nitin Gadkari highlighted these figures, indicating that challenges remain in digital enforcement.

title: Demand for irrigation denied, Maharashtra farmer kills self
content: Kailash Nagare, a 2020 Young Farmer Award recipient, died by suicide, citing government negligence in a note he left behind. His death, attributed to unaddressed irrigation issues, led to significant unrest among farmers in his village, with demands for immediate government response. He is survived by his family.

title: Stalin govt's budget logo swaps ₹ with Tamil letter
content: Tamil Nadu's Stalin government replaced the rupee symbol with a Tamil letter for the state budget, sparking criticism from Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and BJP leaders. They argue that the rupee symbol has national significance and should not be altered. The DMK defends the move as a promotion of regional pride.

title: Cong, CPM question Starlink deal, raise national security fears
content: Opposition parties Congress and CPM expressed national security concerns over the recent partnerships between Airtel, Jio, and Starlink. Congress alleged that PM Modi orchestrated these deals to gain favor with US President Trump via Starlink owner Elon Musk. They questioned the implications for national security and the method of spectrum allocation, emphasizing the critical nature of telecom services for defense.

title: Kuki referendum draft eyes state split
content: A draft referendum ballot has been proposed by the Kuki-Zo tribe in Manipur to decide on creating a Union Territory from Manipur’s hill districts, directly governed by the Centre. The Kuki-Zo Council has withdrawn an indefinite shutdown following a youth's death in a clash with security forces.

title: BJP slams Didi for Santiniketan ‘Holi ban’, TMC denies any such prohibition
content: The BJP criticized the TMC-led West Bengal government for allegedly banning Holi celebrations at Santiniketan, accusing CM Mamata Banerjee of appeasement politics. They urged Hindus to celebrate without fear. The state government clarified that there was no ban, but rather a request for environmental caution in protected areas. The BJP claimed the move was politically motivated.

title: Govt opens up exploration of 13 critical mineral blocks to private companies
content: India opens mineral and rare earth elements exploration to the private sector with 13 acreages up for auction, aiming to unlock untapped resources. The new policy encourages private investment, offering incentives like cost reimbursements and long-term mining leases. Around 25 companies showed interest, and the government hopes to create a thriving mineral exploration ecosystem.

title: 'Killed in front of our eyes': Survivors reveal how Pakistan train hijack unfolded
content: Militants hijacked a train in Pakistan's Balochistan, holding passengers hostage for nearly 36 hours. A successful military operation freed the hostages and eliminated over 30 militants. The BLA claimed responsibility, demanding the release of political prisoners. The attack left 21 civilian hostages and four military personnel dead, with the fate of 140 passengers uncertain.

title: Sambhal’s Jama Masjid covered with tarpaulin ahead of Holi
content: Security measures in Sambhal, UP were heightened ahead of Holi. Shahi Jama Masjid and nine other mosques along the procession route were covered with tarpaulins to prevent colors from reaching religious sites. Over 1,000 people were bound down as a precautionary measure to maintain peace. Officials and community representatives ensured communal harmony.

title: Return Rs 332 crore to Rose Valley scam victims in Odisha: Court
content: A PMLA court in Bhubaneswar has ordered the reimbursement of Rs 332 crore to victims of the Rose Valley chit fund scam in Odisha. The Enforcement Directorate had previously attached the group's assets, now valued at Rs 450 crore, and the Calcutta High Court's Assets Disposal Committee will oversee the fund distribution.

title: UP hires 60,244 cops in country’s biggest job drive
content: The Uttar Pradesh Police Recruitment and Promotion Board announced results for 60,244 constable posts, including significant representation from women and various reservation categories. This concluded the largest state police recruitment, beginning with 48 lakh applications. Following a probe and re-examination, final selections were based on written scores, document verification, and physical tests. Successful candidates will undergo medical checks and training.

title: 2 forest watchers held for Red ties, face UAPA cases
content: Two forest watchers at Kanha National Park in Madhya Pradesh were arrested under UAPA for alleged Maoist ties, sparking fear among forest staff. Police claim they signaled Maoists about security force movements, while forest officials argue they were coerced by Maoists. Evidence suggests a deeper connection with the insurgents than initially admitted.

title: UP trader’s son, 22, arrested for killing 4 during Doon joyride
content: Vansh Katyal, a 22-year-old from Moradabad, was arrested for fatally hitting four labourers on Rajpur Road with a speeding Mercedes. The incident occurred while Katyal was on a joyride with his 12-year-old nephew. After the accident, he abandoned the vehicle and fled to Delhi. He is now in police custody.

title: Blank ‘accused column’ in CBI’s Ranya FIR worries netas & babus
content: In the case involving Kannada actor Ranya Rao, the CBI's FIR in the gold-smuggling racket has left the accused column blank, giving them flexibility in summoning individuals. The DRI suspects a coordinated syndicate between Dubai and India. The ED also raided multiple locations, including Ranya's flat, seizing documents and gadgets, pointing to high-level corruption.

title: Lawrence Super Bowl jab sparks spat with Parsons
content: DeMarcus Lawrence told a Seattle blogger Thursday that he was "not going to win a Super Bowl" in Dallas, a comment that led Cowboys star Micah Parsons to respond: "This what rejection and envy look like! This some clown s---!"

title: Warriors' Curry reaches 4,000 career 3-pointers
content: Stephen Curry became the first player to reach 4,000 3-pointers made in a career, extending the Golden State Warriors superstar's record to the milestone number on Thursday night against the Sacramento Kings.

title: Sources: George, doctors mulling star's injuries
content: 76ers forward Paul George is consulting with doctors this week on treatment options for his groin and knee injuries, including a possible procedure, sources told ESPN.

title: Darnold to apply lessons from disastrous '24 finish
content: New Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold is hoping to apply the lessons he learned from the disappointing end to his 2024 season, when he unraveled in two straight losses.

title: Flagg 'long shot' for ACC semis after ankle injury
content: Duke freshman phenom Cooper Flagg is a "real long shot" to play in the ACC tournament semifinals after suffering a sprained left ankle, coach Jon Scheyer said.

title: Texas' potential bid adds to 'historic' SEC season
content: Texas, the No. 13 seed in the SEC tournament which is on the bubble for the NCAA tournament, beat old foe Texas A&M in double overtime to reach the quarterfinals.

title: Messi scores on return as Miami wins in Jamaica
content: Lionel Messi scored on his return to action as Inter Miami triumphed 2-0 in Jamaica over Cavalier FC on Thursday to qualify for the quarterfinals of the Concacaf Champions Cup.

title: Star Texas golfer apologizes after heckling Rory
content: University of Texas golfer Luke Potter has apologized after he reportedly was removed from the grounds at TPC Sawgrass earlier this week for heckling star golfer Rory McIlroy.

title: 4,000 and counting: Steph Curry adds another 3-point milestone to his résumé
content: The Golden State Warriors star entered the matchup against the Sacramento Kings needing two 3-pointers to reach the mark.

title: Cooper Flagg injury impact: Duke isn't 'Final Four good' without him, more reactions
content: How could Flagg's and Maliq Brown's potential absences impact the Blue Devils on the court -- and on Selection Sunday?

title: Men's Bracketology: UNC's win pushes Xavier and Indiana to the brink
content: Indiana drops down to take the "first team out" spot as North Carolina bumps up after a win over Wake Forest on Thursday.

title: Women's Bracketology: Stephen F. Austin seals spot, but all eyes on Ivy Madness
content: With the final two teams in the field facing off Friday, the center of the Bracketology universe is Providence, Rhode Island.

title: From a South Carolina repeat to UConn ending its title drought: Six teams that could win it all
content: Sixty-eight teams will compete in  March Madness. But these six make up the short list of title contenders.

title: From $342.58 to over $1M, how some NFL players made out with performance bonuses
content: Brock Purdy nearly doubled his salary with performance-based pay, but other payouts were much more modest.

title: NHL playoff watch: Where will the Devils finish?
content: New Jersey currently holds the No. 3 seed in the Metro, but could drop to a wild-card spot -- or worse.

title: Quarterfinal predictions, from Real Madrid-Arsenal to Villa-PSG
content: While the dust settles on this week's drama, let's take an early look at how we think the next round will play out.

title: Álvarez UCL penalty drama could see law change
content: UEFA said it'll "enter discussions with FIFA and IFAB" over a possible change to the rule that saw Julián Álvarez's penalty disallowed in Atlético Madrid's Champions League defeat to Real Madrid on Wednesday.

title: Brentford captain feared sleeping pill addiction
content: Brentford captain Christian Nørgaard has said he feared becoming addicted to sleeping pills after taking the medication to prepare for away games.

title: Simeone: 'Ball doesn't move' on disallowed pen
content: Diego Simeone questioned the decision to disallow Julián Álvarez's crucial penalty in Real Madrid's Champions League shootout win over Atlético Madrid, insisting "the ball doesn't move" after VAR decided the forward had kicked the ball twice.

title: UCL quarterfinals bracket set as Real face Arsenal
content: The Champions League quarterfinals bracket was set Wednesday, and it sends Real Madrid and Paris Saint-Germain toward more English teams standing in their path of the title.

title: Source: Álvarez 'incredulous' over penalty call
content: Julián Álvarez was "incredulous" after his penalty kick was disallowed in Atlético Madrid's Champions League round-of-16 defeat to Real Madrid, a source told ESPN.

title: Mbappé in France squad after 6-month absence
content: Kylian Mbappé on Thursday was included in Didier Deschamps' squad for France's Nations League quarterfinals March 20 and 23, after more than a six-month absence from the team.

title: Kimmich signs new Bayern contract until 2029
content: Joshua Kimmich has signed a contract extension to 2029 at Bayern, joining teammates Jamal Musiala and Alphonso Davies with fresh long-term deals.

title: Amorim 'in a hurry' to win trophies at Man Utd
content: Amorim has said he is "in a hurry" to win trophies at Man United while also admitting that the club heirachy recognise he needs time to deliver success

title: Dick Vitale hands out the only postseason awards that matter
content: With Cooper Flagg mentions galore, here are the best players of the 2024-25 men's college hoops season, according to Dick Vitale.

title: Watkins, Bueckers, Hidalgo headline All-America team -- but who's player of the year?
content: Our experts name their women's college basketball player of the year, All-Americans and biggest surprise.

title: The King, The Stilt and a Splash Brother: Meet the holders of the NBA's most unbreakable records
content: After LeBron James crossed the 50,000-point mark, and Stephen Curry about to surpass an unprecedented 4,000 three-pointers, here are other NBA records that, for now, look to be unbreakable.

title: Team-by-team preview: Can Orlando Pride repeat as champions?
content: With the National Women's Soccer League returning to action this weekend, we take a look at where the 14 clubs stands and how close each is to winning the NWSL championship.

title: From LaLiga to Premier League, the best title races and Champions League chases
content: Some title races (hello, Liverpool) appear over, but there's a lot of must-see races to watch down the stretch as trophies, top-four and relegation is all up for grabs.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Félix not likely to stay at Milan
content: AC Milan will unlikely sign Portugal forward João Félix on a permanent deal. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Every way to bet on Alex Ovechkin's goals record chase
content: Alex Ovechkin is one of the hottest NHL bets, here are the special markets bettors can bet on as he closes in on the goals scored record.

title: Betting buzz: Steelers attract second-most Super Bowl bets this week
content: Bettors were on the Pittsburgh Steelers' Super Bowl odds after the acquisition of wide receiver DK Metcalf

title: Men's pound-for-pound rankings: Where does Bivol land after win? How about 'Tank' Davis?
content: A lot of movement in the top 10, including the return of Junto Nakatani, and Dmitry Bivol jumping over Artur Beterbiev. Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: UFC expert picks, best bets: How Vettori can win in return from layoff
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: PFL 2025: What are the fights and potential matchups to look forward to?
content: The new season of PFL brings new fighters and new weight classes. Here are the best matchups and the reason why you should watch.

title: Pasquantino? Alcantara? Cruz? 20 sleeper picks to target in 2025
content: Which players are Tristan H. Cockcroft higher on than most? Here's a list of 20 names to keep in mind when drafting your 2025 rosters.

title: 'Hold that rock up, baby': DK Metcalf reveals engagement to Normani
content: The couple began dating in 2022 after being introduced by R&B singer Ciara, who is married to Metcalf's former Seahawks teammate Russell Wilson.

title: Denzel Washington speaks to Colorado football
content: The legendary actor memorably played the role of a high school football coach in the 2000 film "Remember the Titans."

title: The story behind the Rupee symbol: how it came into existence?
content: After extensive research, Udaya Kumar Dharmalingam combined the Devanagari ‘Ra’ for rupiah and the Roman ‘R’ for rupees to create the rupee (₹) symbol, giving it a distinctly Indian yet universal identity

title: Siddaramaiah writes to T.N. CM Stalin, requests Shivakumar to attend anti-delimitation meeting in Chennai
content: Karnataka CM supports DMK-led opposition against delimitation, sends Deputy to Chennai meeting with Tamil Nadu CM Stalin

title: The challenge of ‘hidden disability’
content: With the launch of the Newborn Hearing Screening programme by the Mysuru-based All India Institute of Speech and Hearing, laying emphasis on early identification of hearing loss in newborns, nearly 6,000 are screened almost every month to detect hearing loss issues among the infants

title: Campaign against drugs: Battle for Andhra’s future
content: The government is planning to launch an aggressive campaign in schools and colleges to curb the menace of substance abuse; anti-drug clubs on all campuses and an army of mental health counsellors will spearhead the initiative, writes P. Sujatha Varma

title: Kolkata’s Jadavpur University loses Institute of Eminence status
content: It comes as the university remains embroiled in protests amidst rising demands for a student union election

title: The price of pet care in Hyderabad
content: Pet healthcare in Hyderabad is split between affordable but limited government hospitals and costly private clinics offering advanced care. The industry also suffers from weak regulation, inflated pricing and inconsistent veterinary expertise. Siddharth Kumar Singh explores the need for expanded government services, standardised pricing and stricter oversight to bridge this gap and make pet care more accessible

title: How can India meet its rising power demand?
content: Besides economic growth and urbanisation, climate change-induced heat stress is one of the key factors driving electricity demand. Episodes of power shortages in the last two years amid rapid growth in demand pose an important question. How should India act and plan to meet its rising energy demand reliably and cost-effectively?

title: BRS member G. Jagadish Reddy suspended for remainder of Assembly session
content: House adopts motion against the member for “making insulting remarks, derogatory comments against the Speaker”

title: Bengaluru’s AVGC-XR sector goes pale as 110-year-old Technicolor closes shop
content: As many as 3,000 of Technicolor employees lost jobs in Bengaluru recently. The company was the global face of the State’s AVGC-XR, a sector Karnataka has been ambitiously trying to scale up, reports Mini Tejaswi

title: Adopt innovative measures to counter security challenges: Air Chief Marshal A.P. Singh
content: Air Chief Marshal A.P. Singh draws attention towards the hybrid nature of future warfare where the conflict is likely to be spread across multiple domains

title: Karimnagar-based film critic Ponnam Ravichandra to serve as jury member for IFFS Don Quixote Award for Feature Films
content: Karimnagar film critic Ponnam Ravichandra selected as jury member for IFFS Don Quixote Award; NIFF in Kathmandu 2025

title: Kidney disease no longer just for the elderly, young Indians also at risk, say experts
content: Experts stress the importance of maintaining an ideal body weight, consuming a balanced diet and ensuring six to eight hours of sleep crucial steps toward kidney health; despite the increasing prevalence of kidney-related issues among young Indians, awareness remains alarmingly low

title: Haryana civic polls: Congress put up a half-hearted fight, BJP went all out
content: In the results declared on March 12, the BJP came out on top, winning mayoral elections in nine out of 10 municipal corporations.

title: Raising the rusty dust of red soil
content: Residents from six villages of Sindhudurg district in Maharashtra oppose iron ore mining projects entering their lands. Purnima Sah reports on their fear of losing natural resources, livelihoods, and their health, much like Redi, their neighbouring village

title: Rupee symbol creator Udaya Kumar refuses to be drawn into controversy over new logo in Tamil Nadu
content: The logo for the State budget, released by the Tamil Nadu government, carried ‘ரூ’, the first letter of the Tamil word ‘Rubaai’ which denotes the Indian currency in the language.

title: UoH students stage day-long protest against the proposed auction at Kancha Gachibowli
content: Presence of police in large numbers prevented participation from outsiders, who were denied permission to enter the campus

title: Swanky new bus terminus to be constructed on 3.5 acres in Sholinghur at a cost of ₹20 cr.
content: The new spacious terminus will have a waiting hall for commuters, bus bays, a commercial complex, parking lots, a public announcement system, digital time display boards, a time-keeper’s office, water taps, toilets and ramps for people with disabilities.

title: Academic year for Intermediates in Andhra to begin from April 1, instead of June 1
content: HRD Minister Nara Lokesh says the reforms were approved based on public opinion received from January 8 to January 26 to enhance quality, accessibility and governance in Intermediate education.

title: 164 Shakthi teams constituted to tackle crimes against women, children in Andhra Pradesh
content: Inter-State meeting to be held in Visakhapatnam to check smuggling of ganja and other drugs, says DGP Harish Kumar Gupta

title: Government launches India's 1st exploration licence auction for critical minerals
content: Kishan Reddy launches ELs in the presence of Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant in Dona Paula near here, a major reform aimed to unlock India’s untapped critical and mineral resources

title: After Ratnagiri mosque gates rammed during religious procession, police say there was no forcible entry
content: Police file FIR for sloganeering, unlawful assembly; misleading reel deleted, say police; AIMIM slams government for attack on mosque in police presence; local lawyer seeks stronger action

title: ED searches reveal large-scale fraud involving distillery companies
content: Serious irregularities found in the award of tenders, sale of liquor bottles over and above MRP, says Central agency

title: A British surgeon’s documentation of the flora in 17th Century Madras
content: Samuel Browne travelled to several locations around Fort St. George in 1696 and collected 316 specimens. He labelled each with local names and listed the traditional uses of the plants, which he is said to have learned from Tamil-and Telugu-speaking doctors

title: BJP MLC accuses Opposition leaders of blackmailing rice mill owners
content: The issue came to light after Mr. Fuke submitted video and audio clips to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, urging a comprehensive investigation into the matter

title: Jaishankar meets fishermen from Tamil Nadu, promises ‘full support in consular cases’
content: The meeting acquires significance as it comes against the backdrop of India’s “strong protest” against the January 28 firing by the Sri Lankan Navy on 13 Indian fishermen

title: Good sleep is a struggle for many startup founders, business leaders: survey
content: More than 26% of professionals said they are getting less than six hours of sleep in the night, a problem even more pronounced among entrepreneurs

title: A school that has been training police recruits in Tamil Nadu since 1896
content:
The police force was established in the Madras Presidency after the Madras Police Act, 1859, was passed. The first Police Training School was established in Vellore in April 1896. It was shifted to a sprawling campus at Ashok Nagar in Madras in 1976. The first batch of 77 women sub-inspectors passed out of the Ashok  
Nagar campus in 1982

title: Odisha man kills two minor sons when they oppose his remarry decision
content: Grandmother of two children participated in the heinous crime to remove obstacle for his son’s remarriage

title: In Putin's Ukraine Briefing, "Words Of Gratitude" For PM Modi, Trump
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday made his first comments on Washington's plan for a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine.

title: Rupee Symbol Designer Reacts To Controversy Over Tamil Nadu's Move
content: The designer of the rupee symbol has reacted to the controversy over the Tamil Nadu government replacing the sign with the Tamil letter "Ru" in promotional material for the state budget.

title: "Lost A Brilliant Mind": IISER On Scientist's Death In Mohali Parking Row
content: The 39-year-old distinguished scientist died on Tuesday night after his neighbour pushed him to the ground and punched him during an altercation over a parking issue.

title: "I Think It'll Happen": Trump Vows To Annex Greenland
content: US President Donald Trump has expressed confidence that the United States would annex Greenland, emphasizing that North Atlantic Treaty Alliance (NATO) Secretary General Mark Rutte could play a key role in facilitating the acquisition.

title: Promotes Secessionist Sentiments": N Sitharaman Slams DMK's Rupee Move
content: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman has hit back at Tamil Nadu's ruling DMK over its move to replace the rupee symbol with the Tamil letter (Ru), declaring that it "promotes secessionist sentiments"

title: "Wants To Continue War": Zelensky On Putin's "Manipulative" Ceasefire Remark
content: Washington has called for Russia to accept a ceasefire without preconditions but Putin listed a number of obstacles in the way.

title: "Journalism Won't Be Silenced": Telangana Daily Publishes Blank Editorial
content: An Urdu daily in Telangana has published a blank editorial in protest against what it claims is the freezing of government advertisement by the Congress government led by Revanth Reddy.

title: Video: Inside Look At Jagan Reddy's 'Sheeshmahal' In Andhra Pradesh
content: Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal's "Sheeshmahal" that was one of the key focus areas in last month's Delhi election, has stiff competition from a house built for former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy.

title: "Impractical Move": Akhilesh Yadav Questions CBSE Exam Schedule Post Holi
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav on Thursday criticised the schedule of CBSE exams immediately after Holi, calling it an "impractical move" that would cause difficulties for students and parents.

title: Video: American Airlines Plane Catches Fire At Denver Airport
content: A Dallas-bound American Airlines plane caught fire at Denver International Airport on Thursday. There were 178 people onboard, including six crew members.

title: 90s Superstar, That Guy From Forrest Gump Remake: How Does Gen Z See Aamir?
content: For a generation raised on snappy 10-second reels and streaming platforms that offer an endless buffet of content, Aamir Khan is a name that exists somewhere between nostalgia and fading relevance.

title: Thar Driver Who Caused Panic In Noida's Sector 16 Arrested, Fined Rs 38,000
content: A man was arrested after a video of him driving recklessly in Noida's Sector 16 market was circulated on social media, police said on Wednesday.

title: This City Is The World's Most Polluted. Hint: It's Not Delhi
content: A small city on the Meghalaya-Assam border, nearly 2,000 kilometres away from Delhi, is the most polluted in the world, according to a report published by a global pollution watchdog.

title: How Trump's Tariffs On India Will Backfire On The US Healthcare System
content: The US relies heavily on Indian generic medicines, with nearly half of all generic drugs consumed in the US originating from India. This has resulted in significant savings for the US healthcare system.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: A decades-old school that empowers women and denounces untouchability
content: Freedom fighter Sardar Vedarathinam Pillai started Kasthurba Gandhi Kanya Gurukulam at Vedaranyam in 1946. The first women’s residential school in the Cauvery delta region started with only one student; it now serves nearly 2,000 girls, offering regular academic courses and skill-based programmes that help poor students from rural areas

title: Badlapur encounter: Bombay HC questions govt. for not filing FIR against accused cops
content: A Division Bench of Justices Revati Mohite Dere and Neela Gokhale reserved its order on whether an FIR is ought to be registered by the State government

title: Removing ‘₹’ in ‘T.N. Budget documents’ signals a dangerous mindset: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: It weakens Indian unity and promotes secessionist sentiments under the pretence of regional pride, says Finance Minister

title: Centre makes ‘quantum hubs’ operational
content: Under the National Quantum Mission, four Thematic Hubs have been established in key technology verticals of quantum computing, quantum communication, quantum sensing & metrology and quantum materials & devices.

title: Prepare and finalise guidelines before announcing schemes in Budgets: Parliamentary panel to Urban Affairs Ministry
content: The committee made the recommendation with respect to two schemes announced in this year’s Budget — ‘Urban Challenge Fund’ and ‘Scheme for Industrial Housing’ with allocations of ₹10,000 crore and ₹2,500 crore, respectively

title: Manipur MP says question to Home Ministry on pacts with insurgent groups in Northeast ‘removed’
content: Mr. Akoijam posted about this online  social media platform X late on Wednesday night, saying he had met with Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla and Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Kiren Rijiju over this ‘unusual episode’

title: Watch: Sexual abuse & dismissal of 23 school staff in Tamil Nadu
content: This decision came after the department’s final investigation into 46 cases. It is part of an ongoing process where 104 cases were registered over the past decade.

title: Ahead of Holi, Uttar Pradesh Police remain on high alert
content: In at least five sensitive districts, namely Sambhal, Bareilly, Shahjahanpur, Bijnor, and Aligarh some mosques have been covered with tarpaulin to protect from celebratory colour.

title: Kuki-Zo groups end shutdown of Manipur’s National Highways
content: Kuki-Zo Council vows to continue opposition to the free movement of all in Manipur, seeks separate administration; highways had been shut since the death of a protestor in Kangpokpi clashes

title: Leave India if you oppose Holi colours: U.P. Minister
content: Muslim scholars, Opposition leaders accuse Sanjay Nishad of creating division and spreading hatred; they argue that such comment goes against the basic ethos of India’s plural society

title: After early setbacks, Olive Ridley turtle nesting in Tamil Nadu sees significant recovery
content: Volunteers and the T.N. Forest Department have collectively gathered 2,53,719 turtle eggs across the State so far. As of March 11, Cuddalore tops the list with 89,784 eggs collected, followed by the Chennai division with 47,082 eggs

title: 28 children rescued from two brick kilns in West Bengal
content: The children from Bihar and Odisha were engaged as bonded labourers. They were found in appalling conditions. A social worker said that some of the children rescued were toddlers of barely three to four years of age.

title: Telangana Public Service Commission refutes allegations on Group-I Mains evaluation process
content: The Commission clarified that the evaluation was conducted with strict measures to ensure fairness and transparency

title: Kathua killings, ongoing probe do not point to terror angle, says government official
content: The official reasons that if a terror group had killed the three persons, including a teenage boy, then it would have claimed responsibility by now as Pakistani groups generally leave behind a message

title: Rights bodies urge Bombay High Court Chief Justice to stop authorities from banning stalls by Muslims at Kanifnath Yatra
content: The organisations have sought strict compliance and effective implementation of the order to enable safe and respectful working conditions for Muslim vendors

title: YSRCP leader opposes Vijaya Sai Reddy’s comments
content: Vijaya Sai Reddy used to speak for hours with YSRCP president Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy when he was the Chief Minister, and now making such claims was misleading, says Kakani Govardhan Reddy

title: Remnants of festivity removed from roads within hours
content: Corporation’s sanitation workers fan out across the city to clean up the debris left behind after Attukal Pongala

title: Cement companies told to strictly comply with rules pertaining to usage of Refuse Derived Fuel
content: According to the SWM rules, cement kilns should reduce the percentage of coal used and replace it with RDF derived from municipal solid waste, ensuring a minimum usage of 15% for cement production

title: Recount of votes must not compromise ballot secrecy, says SC
content: “Each vote has its own value irrespective of its effect on the final outcome of the election. Its sanctity has to be protected,” says Bench

title: Stone laid for entrance arch works of Bara Shaheed Dargah
content: Nellore Rural MLA asserts to continue his struggle for sanctioning of funds for the construction of the mosque

title: BJP stages protest against State Budget saying it is anti-Hindu, anti-farmer
content: Party leaders ride a bullock cart to the Belagavi Deputy Commissioner’s office and stage a rasta roko at the Rani Channamma Circle

title: Akali Dal to attend anti-delimitation meet in Chennai
content: SAD leader Daljit Singh Cheema and party’s working president Balwinder Bhunder will attend the meeting, the party said
